entry.title: meadow knapweed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that meadow knapweed (example pictured) is a hybrid between black knapweed and brown knapweed, which were both introduced to North America?

entry.title: atheists in Malaysia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that atheists in Malaysia are often threatened with rape and murder?

entry.title: Pride Month (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Pride Month is held in commemoration of the Stonewall riots?

entry.title: Manuel Carpio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Manuel Carpio's 1849 poem is the earliest literary depiction of the weeping ghost La Llorona?

entry.title: Evans Memorial Chapel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Denver's oldest building continuously used for Protestant worship, the Evans Memorial Chapel, is now also used by Catholics?

entry.title: Graham Hawkins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Graham Hawkins coached the Wolverhampton Wanderers to the top division in his first season as a manager?

entry.title: a California TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the studios of a California TV station were converted back into a movie theater after it went out of business?

entry.title: Hirsch Sommerhausen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Hirsch Sommerhausen worked as a court translator in a dozen languages?
